Description: Pyxis; ivory; the base restored in wood; a square opening in the side opposite the join, which is pierced by holes for lacing; carved in relief with goat; two men spearing a bear; shepherdess with crook and man with pair of oxen.
Bibliographic references: Volbach 1976 / Elfenbeinarbeiten der Spätantike und des frühen Mittelalters (103)
Exhibition history: Exhibited; 1977 London, BM, Animals in Art
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Capt. A W F Fuller
Funder name: With contribution from: Art Fund (as NACF)
With contribution from: Capt. A W F Fuller
